mortality.note: Deadliest conflict since WWII. Most deaths from disease and starvation caused by displacement. 9 African nations involved. Conflict over minerals (coltan, diamonds, gold) fueled by global electronics demand.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Multiple state and militia actors. Systematic resource extraction through violence.
rationales.profit: Coltan, diamonds, gold, timber. Corporations and neighboring states extracted resources.
rationales.ideology: Ethnic tensions exploited, but profit drove the war. 'Africa's World War.'
rationales.complicity: Rwanda, Uganda, multinational corporations, consumers of electronics. Ongoing instability.

analysis.pattern_note: Deadliest conflict since WWII but barely known in West. 'Coltan war' - your phone may contain minerals mined by forced labor during this conflict. Multiple perpetrators make attribution complex. Shows how resource extraction creates mass death even without explicit genocide policy. Ongoing instability in eastern DRC traces directly to this war.
warning_signs: Multiple armed groups competing for resources
analysis.root_causes: Post-Mobutu vacuum, Rwandan genocide spillover, mineral wealth, weak state
